definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: He was an unrivalled talent, but unfortunately at the wrong time.
sentences.chinese: 他是个举世无双的奇才，可惜生不逢时。

sentences.english: Welcome to HongKong, a peerless city in entire world.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎莅临香港，一个举世无双的城市。

sentences.english: It's part of the geography of China, and this is totally unique.
sentences.chinese: 它是中国地理的一部分，举世无双，无与伦比。

sentences.english: Pele was in a class of his own as a footballer.
sentences.chinese: 贝利是举世无双的足球健将。

sentences.english: He is unequaled, as a jazz player.
sentences.chinese: 他是位举世无双的爵士乐演奏者。

sentences.english: Ma Hung-Kuei's method of salt distribution was unique.
sentences.chinese: 马鸿逵的食盐专运专销办法可谓举世无双。

definition: first under heaven/number one in the country
one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
the present age/in office/the current office holder
since the dawn of time/from the year dot
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
to surpass all others of its kind before and since/to have neither predecessors nor successors
pinyin: qian2 wu2 gu3 ren2 hou4 wu2 lai2 zhe3
